00035 #include <stdlib.h>
00036 #include <stdio.h>
00037 #include <unistd.h>
00038 #include <sys/types.h>
00039 #include <sys/stat.h>
00040 #include <signal.h>
00041 #include <fcntl.h>
00042 #include <errno.h>
00043 #include <string.h>
00044 #include <sys/wait.h>
00045 #include <time.h>
00046 #include <sys/time.h>

00048 
00049 #define difftime(a, b)                                          \
00050         ((double)(a)->tv_sec - (b)->tv_sec +                    \
00051          ((double)((a)->tv_usec - (b)->tv_usec) / 1000000))
00052 
00053 
00054 
00055 char cmdname[512];
00056 int o_abort = 0;
00057 int o_quiet = 0;
00058 
00059 void usage(char *name)
00060 {
00061         fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s [opts] <dirname> <seconds> <threads>\n",
00062                 name);
00063         fprintf(stderr, "  -q quiet\n");
00064         fprintf(stderr, "  -a abort other children on first err\n");
00065         exit(1);
00066 }
00067 
00068 
00069 struct kid_list_t {
00070         pid_t kid;
00071         struct kid_list_t *next;
00072 };
00073 
00074 struct kid_list_t *head = NULL;
00075 
00076 int push_kid(pid_t kid)
00077 {
00078         struct kid_list_t *new;
00079         new = (struct kid_list_t *)malloc(sizeof(struct kid_list_t));
00080         if (new == NULL)
00081                 return 1;
00082 
00083         new->kid = kid;
00084         new->next = head;
00085         head = new;
00086         return 0;
00087 }
00088 
00089 void kill_kids(void)
00090 {
00091         while(head) {
00092                 kill(head->kid, SIGTERM);
00093                 head = head->next;
00094         }
00095 }
00096 
00097 static int usr1_received;
00098 void usr1_handler(int unused)
00099 {
00100         usr1_received = 1;
00101         kill_kids();
00102 }
00103 
00104 int wait_for_threads(int live_threads)
00105 {
00106         int rc = 0;
00107 
00108         while (live_threads > 0) {
00109                 int status;
00110                 pid_t ret;
00111 
00112                 ret = waitpid(0, &status, 0);
00113                 if (ret == 0) {
00114                         continue;
00115                 }
00116 
00117                 if (ret < 0) {
00118                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: error: wait - %s\n",
00119                                 cmdname, strerror(errno));
00120                         if (!rc)
00121                                 rc = errno;
00122                 } else {
00123                         /*
00124                          * This is a hack.  We _should_ be able to use
00125                          * WIFEXITED(status) to see if there was an
00126                          * error, but it appears to be broken and it
00127                          * always returns 1 (OK).  See wait(2).
00128                          */
00129                         int err = WEXITSTATUS(status);
00130                         if (err)
00131                                 fprintf(stderr,
00132                                         "%s: error: PID %d had rc=%d\n",
00133                                         cmdname, ret, err);
00134                         /* Record first error */
00135                         if (!rc)
00136                                 rc = err;
00137 
00138                         /* Give up on first error */
00139                         if (rc && o_abort) {
00140                                 kill_kids();
00141                                 break;
00142                         }
00143 
00144                         live_threads--;
00145                 }
00146         }
00147         if (!o_quiet)
00148                 printf("%s done, rc = %d\n", cmdname, rc);
00149         return rc;
00150 }
00151 
00152 void print_err(char *op, char *filename, struct timeval *time, int err)
00153 {
00154         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %d.%.06d error: %s(%s): %s\n",
00155                 cmdname, (int)(time->tv_sec), (int)(time->tv_usec), op,
00156                 filename, strerror(errno));
00157 }
00158 
00159 int run_one_child(char *file, int thread, int seconds)
00160 {
00161         struct timeval start, cur;
00162         double diff;
00163         char filename[1024];
00164         char buf[1024];
00165         int fd, rc = 0, rand, maxrand, len;
00166         long nfiles = 0, nbytes = 0;
00167 
00168         if (!o_quiet)
00169                 printf("%s: running thread #%d\n", cmdname, thread);
00170 
00171         srandom(thread);
00172         /* Higher thread numbers will produce bigger random files.
00173            Thread 1 will produce only 0-len files. */
00174         maxrand = 1; rand = thread;
00175         while (--rand)
00176                 maxrand *= 10;
00177 
00178         gettimeofday(&start, NULL);
00179         cur = start;
00180 
00181         while(!rc) {
00182                 if (usr1_received)
00183                         break;
00184 
00185                 gettimeofday(&cur, NULL);
00186                 if (seconds) {
00187                         if (cur.tv_sec > (start.tv_sec + seconds))
00188                                 break;
00189                 }
00190                 
00191                 snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename), "%s-%d-%ld",
00192                          file, thread, nfiles);
00193 
00194                 fd = open(filename, O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0666);
00195                 if (fd < 0) {
00196                         print_err("open", filename, &cur, errno);
00197                         rc = errno;
00198                         break;
00199                 }
00200 
00201                 sprintf(buf, "%s %010ld %.19s.%012d\n", cmdname,
00202                         nfiles++, ctime(&cur.tv_sec), (int)cur.tv_usec);
00203                 len = strlen(buf);
00204 
00205                 rand = random() % maxrand;
00206                 while (rand-- > 0) {
00207                         if (write(fd, buf, len) != len) {
00208                                 print_err("write", filename, &cur, errno);
00209                                 rc = errno;
00210                                 break;
00211                         }
00212                         nbytes += len;
00213                 }
00214 
00215                 if (close(fd) < 0) {
00216                         print_err("close", filename, &cur, errno);
00217                         rc = errno;
00218                         break;
00219                 }
00220                 if (unlink(filename) < 0) {
00221                         print_err("unlink", filename, &cur, errno);
00222                         if (errno == ENOENT) {
00223                                 printf("Ignoring known bug 6082\n");
00224                         } else {
00225                                 rc = errno;
00226                                 break;
00227                         }
00228                 }
00229         }
00230 
00231         diff = difftime(&cur, &start);
00232         if (!o_quiet)
00233                 printf("%s: %7ld files, %4ld MB in %.2fs (%7.2f files/s, "
00234                        "%5.2f MB/s): rc = %d\n",
00235                        cmdname, nfiles, nbytes >> 20, diff,
00236                        diff == 0 ? (double)0 : (double)nfiles / diff,
00237                        diff == 0 ? (double)0 : (double)nbytes/1024/1024 / diff,
00238                        rc);
00239 
00240         return rc;
00241 }
00242 
00243 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00244 {
00245         unsigned long duration;
00246         int threads = 0;
00247         char *end;
00248         char *directory;
00249         int i = 1, rc = 0;
00250 
00251         snprintf(cmdname, sizeof(cmdname), "%s", argv[0]);
00252 
00253         while((i < argc) && (argv[i][0] == '-')) {
00254                 switch (argv[i][1]) {
00255                 case 'q':
00256                         o_quiet++;
00257                         break;
00258                 case 'a':
00259                         o_abort++;
00260                         break;
00261                 }
00262                 i++;
00263         }
00264 
00265         if ((argc - i) < 3)
00266                 usage(argv[0]);
00267 
00268         directory = argv[i];
00269         duration = strtoul(argv[++i], &end, 0);
00270         if (*end) {
00271                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: error: bad number of seconds '%s'\n",
00272                         cmdname, argv[i]);
00273                 exit(2);
00274         }
00275 
00276         threads = strtoul(argv[++i], &end, 0);
00277         if (*end) {
00278                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: error: bad thread count '%s'\n",
00279                         cmdname, argv[i]);
00280                 exit(2);
00281         }
00282 
00283         signal(SIGUSR1, usr1_handler);
00284 
00285         for (i = 1; i <= threads; i++) {
00286                 rc = fork();
00287                 if (rc < 0) {
00288                         if (!o_quiet)
00289                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: error: #%d - %s\n",
00290                                         cmdname, i, strerror(rc = errno));
00291                         return (rc);
00292                 }
00293                 if (rc == 0) {
00294                         /* children */
00295                         snprintf(cmdname, sizeof(cmdname), "%s-%d", argv[0], i);
00296                         return (run_one_child(directory, i, duration));
00297                 } else {
00298                         /* parent */
00299                         rc = push_kid(rc);
00300                         if (rc != 0) {
00301                                 kill_kids();
00302                                 exit(3);
00303                         }
00304                 }
00305         }
00306         /* parent process */
00307         if (!o_quiet)
00308                 printf("%s will run for %ld minutes\n", cmdname, duration/60);
00309         return (wait_for_threads(threads));
00310 }
